section.heading: Scope.
section.text: This chapter establishes standards which determine the penalty for any licensed veterinarian who violates any statute or Board regulation governing the practice of veterinary medicine in this State.

section.heading: Penalty When License Suspended or Revoked.
section.text: After a hearing, the Board may impose a penalty on a veterinarian:

para.text: Instead of or in addition to suspending a veterinarian's license; or
In addition to revoking a veterinarian's license.

section.heading: Violations.
section.text: The Board may impose a penalty on a veterinarian who does any of the following:

para.text: Fails to provide direct supervision for employees;
Practices veterinary medicine without a current registration;
Operates a veterinary hospital without a veterinary hospital license;
Fails to conform to minimum sanitary standards for veterinary facilities;
Conducts a veterinary practice in a manner which violates professional and ethical standards;
Violates a Board regulation after receiving a license;
Engages in false or misleading advertising;
Obtains a license to practice veterinary medicine by fraud or misrepresentation;
Employs or permits an unlicensed person to practice veterinary medicine;
Employs or permits a veterinarian who does not possess a current veterinary registration to practice veterinary medicine;
Practices veterinary medicine without a valid license issued by the Board;
Conducts a veterinary practice incompetently;
Violates any federal or State law relating to narcotic drugs;
Is convicted of a felony, or of a crime involving moral turpitude;
Is deliberately cruel to an animal; or
Is grossly negligent in the practice of veterinary medicine.

section.heading: Classification of Violations for the Purpose of Determining Penalties.

para.text: For a violation of Regulation .03A—F of this chapter, a penalty may be imposed by the Board considering the nature and gravity of each violation consistent with the following standards:
For the first violation, a penalty of not less than $300 or more than $3,000;
For the second violation, a penalty of not less than $600 or more than $6,000;
For the third and any subsequent violation, a penalty of not less than $3,000 or more than $10,000.
For a violation of Regulation .03G-J, a penalty may be imposed by the Board considering the nature and gravity of each violation consistent with the following standards:
For the first violation, a penalty of not less than $600 or more than $5,000;
For the second violation, a fine of not less than $3,000 or more than $10,000;
For the third and any subsequent violation, a penalty of not less than $6,000 or more than $10,000.
For a violation of Regulation .03K—P of this chapter, a penalty may be imposed by the Board considering the nature and gravity of each violation consistent with the following standards:
For the first violation, a penalty of not less than $3,000 or more than $5,000;
For the second violation, a penalty of not less than $6,000 or more than $10,000;
For the third and any subsequent violation, a penalty of not less than $8,000 or more than $10,000.

section.heading: Appeal.
section.text: A veterinarian may appeal the Board's decision to impose a penalty as provided in Agriculture Article, § 2-405, Annotated Code of Maryland. A veterinarian shall be notified of this right to appeal.

section.heading: Penalty Payment.
section.text: Unless a veterinarian appeals, the amount of a penalty shall be paid promptly to the Board.
